description: This is a modern 'Nodes View' dashboard for your Kubernetes cluster(s). Made for kube-prometheus-stack and take advantage of the latest Grafana features. GitHub repository: https://github.com/dotdc/grafana-dashboards-kubernetes

panels.description: Select a node to see CPU using in %
panels.title: CPU  Usage by $instance

panels.description: Select a node to see Memory using in %
panels.title: Memory Usage by $node

panels.description: Select a node to see CPU cores usage in the instance
panels.title: CPU cores using by $node

panels.description: Select a node to see Total CPU cores in the instance
panels.title: Total CPU Total Cores

panels.description: Select a node to see Memory using in bytes by the instance
panels.title: Memory using in bytes by $node

panels.description: Select a node to see total Memory (bytes) by the instance
panels.title: Total Memory by $node

panels.description: Time, how long the node has been running since its last boot.
panels.title: uptime

panels.description:
CPU using on Node in different modes
**Idle** – CPU is available and not performing any tasks.
**iowait** – Waiting for disk or network operations to complete.
**irq** – Handling hardware interrupts.
**nice** – Running lower-priority tasks.
**softirq** – Processing software interrupts, such as networking or timers.
**steal** – In VMs, CPU time taken by the hypervisor, affecting performance.
**system** – Running system/kernel-level tasks.
**user** – Executing user applications and user-space programs.
panels.title: CPU Usage by $node

panels.description:
Memory usage on Node in different modes.
**RAM Used** – Memory currently in use by applications and system processes.
**RAM Total** – Total available system memory.
**RAM Cache** – Memory storing frequently accessed data for faster retrieval.
**RAM Buffer** – Temporary memory for data before being written to disk.
**RAM Free** – Unused memory available for new applications.
**SWAP Used** – Swap space in use when RAM is full.
**SWAP Total** – Total allocated swap space for virtual memory.
panels.title: Memory Usage by $node

panels.description: CPU cores usage by pods on the node over on time-based graph
panels.title: CPU usage by Pod (cores)

panels.description: Memory bytes usage by pods on the node over on time-based graph
panels.title: Memory usage by Pod (bytes)

panels.description: Number of times a CPU core has been throttled on an instance. indicating that pods exceeded their CPU limits and were restricted by the Kubernetes scheduler. (Displays only throttled pods based on the selected time range.)
panels.title: Number of CPU Core Throttled

title: Kubernetes / Views / Nodes
